contentrichtext.text: {{For|the [[English Civil War]] reenactment association|The Sealed Knot (reenactment)}} The '''Sealed Knot''' was a secret [[Cavalier|Royalist]] association which plotted for the [[English Restoration|Restoration]] of the Monarchy during the [[English Interregnum]].<ref name="Roberts">{{cite encyclopedia | title=Sealed Knot (act. 1653-1659) | encyclopedia=Oxford Dictionary of National Biography | publisher=Oxford University Press | accessdate=2013-06-11 | author=Roberts, Stephen K | year=2004}}</ref> Its original founder members were:<ref name="Roberts" /> * [[John Belasyse, 1st Baron Belasyse]] (1614-1689) * Sir [[William Compton (army officer)|William Compton]] (1625-1663; third son of [[Spencer Compton, 2nd Earl of Northampton]]) * [[Henry Hastings, 1st Baron Loughborough]] (1610-1666) * Col. [[John Russell (Royalist)|John Russell]] * Col. Sir [[Edward Villiers (1620â€“1689)|Edward Villiers]] (1620-1689; father of [[Edward Villiers, 1st Earl of Jersey]]) * Sir [[Richard Willis (spy)|Richard Willis]] (sometimes spelt 'Willys') (1613/14-1690) The Sealed Knot made eight attempts between 1652 and 1659 to bring about the Restoration.<ref name="Carlton">{{cite book | url=http://books.google.com/books?id=rKL6nADScBkC&pg=PT281&dq=Sealed+Knot+eight+Charles+attempts&hl=en&sa=X&ei=H6i2UdW0GIqy9gToq4DgBA&ved=0CC0Q6AEwAA | title=This Seat of Mars: War and the British Isles, 1485-1746 | publisher=Yale University Press | author=Carlton, Charles | year=2011 | isbn=0300180888}}</ref> The biggest revolt was staged in 1655 and is known as the [[Penruddock uprising]], named after one of the leaders of the revolt, [[John Penruddock]]. The revolt was easily put down by forces loyal to the [[Lord Protector]] [[Oliver Cromwell]], and for his part in the rebellion Penruddock was beheaded in May 1655.<ref name="Roberts" /> ==See also== * [[John Thurloe]], spymaster for Oliver Cromwell. ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Knot, Sealed}} [[Category:English Civil War]] [[Category:Cavaliers]] [[Category:Interregnum (England)]]
